title: Looking for font in sports club's logo
author: DJoker_Method

comments.content:
This could be the Bitstream version of Handel Gothic, or a typeface based on Handel, called Fourche:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/handel-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317163105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/handel-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/handel-gothic/")  
 [http://www.shyfoundry.com/fonts/shareware/sffourche.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317163105/http:/www.shyfoundry.com/fonts/shareware/sffourche.html "http://www.shyfoundry.com/fonts/shareware/sffourche.html")

NOTE: only the Bitstream version of Handel has the straight-legged R and the rounded U--all the others have a curved leg R and/or a U with one straight side.

TSVOI looks artificially widened, if it is Fourche.

**ITC Handel Gothic** (and probably others) also have the straight /R & rounded /U as alternates:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/handel-gothic/std-medium/glyphs.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317163105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/handel-gothic/std-medium/glyphs.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/handel-gothic/std-medium/glyphs.html")

I stand corrected, Fivos.

I'm a type nerd, but not quite a big enough one to go trolling through the glyph maps....
Thanks, I checked SF Fourche out and it truly seems to have been slightly widened for the logo. But it's definitely a right fit.
